00020 int sendall(const int sock, const char *buf, const size_t len)
00021 {
00022         size_t tosend = len;
00023         while (tosend > 0) {
00024                 ssize_t bytes = send(sock, buf, tosend, 0);
00025                 if (bytes <= 0) 
00026                         break; // send() was not successful, so stop.
00027                 tosend -= (size_t) bytes;
00028                 buf += bytes;
00029         };
00030 
00031         return tosend == 0 ? 0 : -1;
00032 }

00040 int recvline(const int sock, char *buf, const size_t buflen)
00041 {
00042         int status = 0; // Return status.
00043         size_t bufleft = buflen;
00044 
00045         while (bufleft > 1) {
00046                 // Read one byte from scoket.
00047                 ssize_t bytes = recv(sock, buf, 1, 0);
00048                 if (bytes <= 0) {
00049                         // recv() was not successful, so stop.
00050                         status = -1;
00051                         break;
00052                 } else if (*buf == '\n') {
00053                         // Found end of line, so stop.
00054                         *buf = 0; // Replace end of line with a null terminator.
00055                         status = 0;
00056                         break;
00057                 } else {
00058                         // Keep going.
00059                         bufleft -= 1;
00060                         buf += 1;
00061                 }
00062         }
00063         *buf = 0; // add null terminator in case it's not already there.
00064 
00065         return status;
00066 }

00072 int process_config_line(char *line, config_params *params, int s_table)
00073 {
00074         int x;
00075         
00076         // Ignore comments.
00077         if (line[0] == CONFIG_COMMENT_CHAR)
00078                 return 0;
00079 
00080         // Extract config parameter name and value.
00081         char name[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00082         char value[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00083         //We assume we will absorb only the first two strings we see.
00084         int items = sscanf(line, "%s %s \n", name, value);
00085 
00086         // Line wasn't as expected.
00087         if (items != 2)
00088                 return -1;
00089 
00090         // Process this line.
00091         if (strcmp(name, "server_host") == 0) {
00092                 //strncpy(params->server_host, value, sizeof params->server_host);
00093                 return 1;
00094         } else if (strcmp(name, "server_port") == 0) {
00095                 //params->server_port = atoi(value);
00096                 return 2;
00097         } else if (strcmp(name, "username") == 0) {
00098                 //strncpy(params->username, value, sizeof params->username);
00099                 return 3;
00100         } else if (strcmp(name, "password") == 0) {
00101                 //strncpy(params->password, value, sizeof params->password);
00102                 return 4;
00103         }
00104         else if (strcmp(name, "table")==0){
00105                 // Heindrik: check for any duplicates
00106                 for (x = 0; x <= s_table; x++){
00107                         if (strcmp(value, params->table_names[x])==0)
00108                                 return 6; 
00109                 }
00110                 //if no duplicates, program will proceed
00111                 strncpy(params->table_names[s_table], value, sizeof params->table_names[s_table]);
00112                 return 5;
00113         } else if (strcmp(name, "#") == 0) {
00114                 // Ignore any parameters that begin with "#"
00115         }
00116         // else if (strcmp(name, "data_directory") == 0) {
00117         //      strncpy(params->data_directory, value, sizeof params->data_directory);
00118         //} 
00119         else {
00120                 // Ignore unknown config parameters.
00121         }
00122     return 0;
00123 }

00126 int read_config(const char *config_file, config_params *params)
00127 {
00128         int error_occurred = 0;
00129         int params_ID = 0;
00130         int s_host = 0;
00131         int s_port = 0;
00132         int s_user = 0;
00133         int s_pass = 0;
00134         int s_table = 0; //counts number of TABLE
00135         
00136         // Open file for reading.
00137         FILE *file = fopen(config_file, "r");
00138         if (file == NULL)
00139                 error_occurred = 1;
00140 
00141         // Process the config file.
00142         while (!error_occurred && !feof(file)) {
00143                 // Read a line from the file.
00144                 char line[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00145                 char *l = fgets(line, sizeof line, file);
00146                 
00147                 // Heindrik: Track the number of paramaters
00148                 if (params_ID == 1)
00149                         s_host++;
00150                 else if (params_ID == 2)
00151                         s_port++;
00152                 else if (params_ID == 3)
00153                         s_user++;
00154                 else if (params_ID == 4)
00155                         s_pass++;
00156                 else if (params_ID == 5)
00157                         s_table++;
00158                 
00159                 params->num_tables =s_table; //WE HAVE THE NUMBER OF TABLES THAT EXIST!
00160 
00161                 // Heindrik: Check if the there are duplicates
00162                 if (s_host > 1 ||s_port > 1 || s_user > 1 || s_pass > 1 || params_ID == 6)
00163                         return ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00164                 
00165                 // Process the line.
00166                 if (l == line)
00167                         params_ID = process_config_line(line, params,s_table);
00168                 else if (!feof(file))
00169                         error_occurred = 1;
00170         }
00171         
00172         // Heindrik: check if missing arguments
00173         if (s_host==0||s_port==0||s_user==0||s_pass==0||s_table==0){
00174                 return ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00175         }
00176 
00177         return error_occurred ? -1 : 0;
00178 }

00182 
00183         if (LOGGING == 0){

00196 //Access the time.h file to print the current date and time based on the machine.
00197 char *currentDateTime(){
00198         time_t currentTime= time(0);
00199         struct tm tstruct;
00200         char *buffer= (char*)malloc(100*sizeof(char));
00201         tstruct = *localtime(&currentTime);
00202 
00203         strftime(buffer,100,"%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S", &tstruct);
00204         return buffer;
00205 }

00207 char *generate_encrypted_password(const char *passwd, const char *salt)
00208 {
00209         if(salt != NULL)
00210                 return crypt(passwd, salt);
00211         else
00212                 return crypt(passwd, DEFAULT_CRYPT_SALT);
00213 }

00242                                         return -1; // error not a valid character

00247         return 0;

00250 char* add_delimiter(char* input){
00251         int i;
00252         for (i=0;i<strlen(input);i++){
00253                 if (input[i]==' '){
00254                         input[i]= '#';
00255                 }
00256         }
00257         return input;

00271 int timeval_subtract(struct timeval *result, struct timeval *t2, struct timeval *t1)
00272 {
00273     long int diff = (t2->tv_usec + 1000000 * t2->tv_sec) - (t1->tv_usec + 1000000 * t1->tv_sec);
00274     result->tv_sec = diff / 1000000;
00275     result->tv_usec = diff % 1000000;
00276 
00277     return (diff<0);
00278 }

00280 int type_identifier (char string[800]){
00281     int x;
00282     int identify = 0;
00283     for (x=0;x<800;x++){
00284         if ( (string[x]>= '0' && string[x]<= '9') || string[x]==' '|| string[0] =='-'){
00285             identify = 0;
00286         }
00287         else if (string[x] == '\0')
00288             break;
00289         else if (string[x]=='.'){
00290                 identify = 2;
00291                 break;
00292         }
00293         else {
00294             identify = 1;
00295             break;
00296         }
00297     }
00298     return identify;
00299 }
